koohiiStory1: To upbraid someone, you criticize them in a menacing way. In other words, you jaw at them with your MOUTH until both sides of their face turn RED (hence the double-red).
koohiiStory2: Tip: Heisig later names 赫 "red + red" as incandescent (#2908). Story: "So the boss upbraided you, huh?". "Yep, his mouth was incandescent.

humanum_full_description_en:
From " mouth ", " he " sound. The original meaning is anger. "Jade articles. "Mouth": "Scared, people call scared by the gap." Such as "Zhuangzi. "Autumn Water": "So the horned rat caught the rat, the buckwheat passed it, and looked up and said: "Scare!"

" Scare " means intimidation by extension. Such as "Selected Works. Bao Mingyuan "Wucheng Fu": "Hungry eagle kisses hard, cold owl scares the young." Northern Song Dynasty Sima Guang, "Shui Shui Ji Wen." "Wang Qinruo was greatly known": "The prisoners feared Her with false words, and may not dare to come."

" Scare " also means to make fear. For example, Han Yu in the Tang Dynasty "Xian Zhai You Huai": "When children grow up, the mice will have to frighten them." Kong Shangren in the Qing Dynasty "Peach Blossom Fan. "Cry the Lord": "Unexpectedly, the world turned upside down tonight, I was scared to death."

" Scare " also means opening up. Such as "Selected Works. Guo Jingchun's "Jiang Fu": "Either explode to shake the abyss, or scare the gills into the rocks."

humanum_full_description:
從「口」，「赫」聲。本義是怒斥聲。《玉篇．口部》：「嚇，以口距人謂之嚇。」如《莊子．秋水》：「於是鴟得腐鼠，鵷鶵過之，仰而視曰：『嚇！』」成玄英疏：「嚇，怒而拒物聲也。」

　　「嚇」引申表示恐嚇。如《文選．鮑明遠〈蕪城賦〉》：「飢鷹厲吻，寒鴟嚇雛。」北宋司馬光《涑水記聞．王欽若大被知遇》：「虜以虛言相恐赫耳，未必敢來。」

　　「嚇」亦表示使害怕。如唐代韓愈〈縣齋有懷〉：「兒童稍長成，雀鼠得驅嚇。」清代孔尚任《桃花扇．哭主》：「不料今夜天翻地覆，嚇死俺也。」

　　「嚇」還表示張開。如《文選．郭景純〈江賦〉》：「或爆采以晃淵，或嚇鰓乎巖間。」
